STUDIES.FIRST: My programming studies started at Cotuca, a technical school in Campinas, where I took a 2-year course learning Java, .NET, SQL, Python, and a little bit of Arduino, as well as other technologies.
STUDIES.SECOND: After finishing these 2 years, I tried some internship processes to get into different companies. Eventually I joined CI&T as an Intern, out of 1200 participants I was one of the 90 who joined.
STUDIES.THIRD: In my first year as an intern I worked at a health insurance company, a client of CI&T, where I learned the best practices in software development, Spring Boot, Angular, Unit Testing, Component Testing, some terms and knowledge about the market in general.
STUDIES.FOURTH: I worked on a product for scheduling patient appointments with doctors, through an App, a microservices infrastructure created specifically for this flow, and also an angular web platform where the doctor's assistant could choose the best time for the patient and for the doctor.
STUDIES.FIFTH: After almost two years working at Sulamerica, I moved to one of the largest national banks in Brazil, which is also a CI&T client, since then I have been working with LGPD and registration data in a product for the bank.
